Test Name: Postmortem Cardiomyopathy and Arrhythmia Gene Panel
Specimen Type: Postmortem tissue (heart, liver, or other relevant tissues)
Purpose: To detect genetic mutations linked to cardiomyopathy and arrhythmia in postmortem tissue samples.
Container: Fresh-frozen cryovial or formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) block
Equipment: High-throughput sequencer (e.g., Illumina or Ion Torrent), DNA extraction kit, Qubit fluorometer, Bioanalyzer, thermal cycler, centrifuge, pipettes
